messages.content:
Categorize this IT Ticket:

archiving issue on sent december re mailbox quota hi folder visible but quota increased for guess problem with archive folder might be related fact using for can folder when web app but can set retention policy was searching line for some help what found site note order for your archive mailbox work with for your archive primary mailboxes must be either server premises or if your primary mailbox server for example your archive you won be able use your archive talk your or about locating them guess could be problem regards head testing belgrade date wednesday december mailbox quota hello please be advised we have set archiving option for your mailbox increased your size with left side your screen folder appear named archive after complete synchronization takes place approximately hours your tab tags section assign policy become available click list archive policy select months having option enabled older than months get archived creating more space your mailbox view be similar one print screen please check status your mailbox quota if improves after hours have passed best regards analyst ext sent december request assigned hello please be advised record number assigned please review details take appropriate action reference number details null choose request template if applicable please provide short description your request mailbox quota request details need have mailbox quota be raised currently have delete monthly basis load quite big please forward request proper have permission work such tasks add requested for contact testing address location belgrade line manager location belgrade access request please click following link kind regards ref msg

While there's a minor mention of access, the main issue centers on managing storage and mailbox capacity, ultimately requiring adjustments related to data storage for email and related concerns.


**Determining the Best Category**

I've been assessing the ticket details to pinpoint the root cause and ensure an accurate category assignment. My recent analysis focused on the context provided, highlighting "Storage" as the core theme. The phrases "mailbox quota," "archiving," and "data load" solidify this categorization. The user's goal revolves around storage, and now I'm certain that Storage is the proper focus.
